intro: Iria subaristata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved iria, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, pale yellow to white flowers. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slight pubescence. Iria subaristata is typically found in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and wet meadows.
